block.p: AMERICAN HOME PRODUCTS, Madison, N.J., named Robert A. Essner, executive vice president at American Home Products and president at its Wyeth-Ayerst Pharmaceuticals subsidiary, to the posts of president and chief operating officer. As president, Mr. Essner succeeds John Stafford, who remains chairman and chief executive. The chief operating officer post is new.

ARTHUR ANDERSEN, Chicago, named Terry E. Hatchett, managing partner for Asia Pacific, to the new office of the chief executive, a post he will share with worldwide managing partner Jim Wadia, the current chief executive.

BAKER HUGHES, Houston, named Michael Wiley chairman, chief executive and president, succeeding Max Lukens, who left in January. Mr. Wiley had been president and chief operating officer at ARCO, until it was bought by BP Amoco in April.
